  • Method Details

    • multipleMove

      public List<Position> multipleMove(PieceDirections directions, Chessboard board, Piece piece)
      Description copied from interface: PieceMovement
      Given a Piece, a Chessboard, and a set of PieceDirections, return a list of all the positions that the piece can move to. The function takes in a set of directions, which is a list of directions that the piece can move in.
      Specified by:
      multipleMove in interface PieceMovement
      Parameters:
      directions - The directions the piece can move in.
      board - The chessboard that the piece is on.
      piece - The piece that is moving
      Returns:
      A list of positions that the piece can move to.

    • singleMove

      public List<Position> singleMove(PieceDirections directions, Chessboard board, Piece piece)
      Description copied from interface: PieceMovement
      This method is used by the King and Knight in order to return the list of possible position. It iterates only for the piece's direction since for those pieces you don't need to iterate for the entire board.
      Specified by:
      singleMove in interface PieceMovement
      Parameters:
      directions - the piece's directions.
      board - the current board.
      piece - the piece.
      Returns:
      a list of position the piece can go to.
